page.title: 19Farming
page.content: The physical features of our area govern the type of farming to be found here. The land rises and falls steeply in places and much of the land is well over 200 feet above sea level. Apart from one small area near Riber Castle where corn and fruit are grown, the majority of the land is used for grass. Where possible the grass is mown for silage or hay and used for grazing. In rougher areas where the soil is thin and there are rocky outcrops the land is used for rough grazing. There are also large areas of deciduous woodland. The majority of farmers use the mixed farming methods, many keeping cows for milk on their better pastures, rearing bullocks for meat and keeping sheep on their scrub- land.
